availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: William H. Baley (Caldwell County, Kentucky, dry goods merchant)

body.p: Caldwell County, Kentucky, dry goods merchant. Georgia native. Son of Eliza Baley. Married to Mary Ann Pearce Baley in Montgomery County, Tennessee, on November 15, 1855. Father of James Baley. Resident in Paducah, Kentucky, in 1850. Dry goods merchant in Princeton in 1860. Owned four enslaved persons in Princeton in 1860. Hired one enslaved person out to J. Pearce in Princeton in 1860.

ab.bibl:
Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Population Schedules, Kentucky, McCracken County, Paducah and Suburbs, p. 148A.
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Caldwell County, Princeton, p. 107.
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Slave Schedules, Kentucky, Caldwell County, Princeton, p. 218A.
Tennessee State Marriages, 1780-2002, Tennessee State Library and Archives, Nashville, TN, Montgomery County Marriages, 1838-1874.
